main event: A bright star-like object was observed over Toledo, Ohio on January 6, 1956. The object moved at approximately 3 times the speed of the moon and small objects seemed to tumble out of it like sparks from a Roman Candle flare.
interesting points: The object appeared and disappeared at irregular intervals, approximately 5 minutes apart.
The observer used a telescope to observe the object and saw multiple lights on it.
Small spark-like lights were seen falling from the main object.
A second witness, the observer's wife, was able to see the lights with the unaided eye.
The object was observed for around 15 minutes.
sighted object: A bright star-like object with smaller lights
